title: I got a really strange email.
body:
I checked my email, and it said I sent in a support ticket to riot games. I've never done this in months.

I check the message, it told me I sent:

> This is a follow-up to your previous request #[ticket number] "There is something wrong wi..."
> 
> Hello!
> 
> Just take a look at that amazing and wonderful stuff, you're going to love it for sure! More info here [malicious URL] 
> 
> All best, [My real first and last name]

First of all, riot games does not know my own personal information, they would not know my full name (I wouldn't think so anyway) and I would never send an email like this. To player support, I never had the need to except when I was giving a personal opinion about something, and when I wanted to bug report something major with my main that was ignored on the boards. I did not click the link, cause that's obviously something malicious even by how the URL looks.

I don't see any harm done, but something in your system is really unsecure. I don't want banned because through my email somebody sent a message I never sent providing a malicious link.

replies.body:
That email was not sent by us at Player Support, nor from anyone from Riot. We will not reach out to you via email without you first contacting us, and we definitely would not use your first and last name as we do not ever gather that type of information. My best guess is that someone was trying to trick you into clicking on that link in order to steal your personal information. 

Check out our article on [**emails from Riot Games**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751784-Emails-from-Riot-Games) for all the emails we will use, and if it doesn't match those domains then it definitely was not from us.
